title: Accuracy and Expression as Opponent Processing:  An Archaeological Dig into Language and History:
description:
A discussion of Owen Barfield's book, Speaker's Meaning.
https://www.amazon.com/Speakers-Meaning-Owen-Barfield/dp/095694230X/ref=sr_1_1?dchild=1&keywords=speaker%27s+meaning&qid=1625781053&sr=8-1

It takes us a few minutes to get it off the ground, but your patience will be rewarded by some rich dialogos as it goes on.

Jordan Peterson's research on Entropy and Psychology:
Here's the only way to get a downloadable pdf of the paper.
Go to this link, scroll half way down to the paper entitled Psychological Entropy, a Framework for Understanding Uncertainty-Related Anxiety, click on the link and it will take you to a page that offers a downloadable PDF. That PDF can't be shared, as the only thing that shares is the first page. You can however, cut and paste the article into a doc and save it.
https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Jordan-Peterson-9

Lexical meaning v. speaker's meaning reflects the same paradigm Barfield sets up with his discussion of history being composed of both accuracy and expression.
The ancient view of history was as a process of descent from a golden past, trying to preserve the golden model - in a sense, culture was trying to preserve that cultural DNA so that we would have the model when things begin to degrade.

Communication and Expression, or Accuracy and Fullness, are similar to the left and right hemisphere acting as opponent processors.

History now is seen as evolving towards a progressive ideal according to the modern assumptions about progress.
Polarity v. Paradox
Polarities exist by virtue of each other
Limitations increase the shared overlap and allow dialogos to happen.

Dialogos is the moreness - the infinite manifesting itself in the finite.
Limitations lens holographically the larger realities.
(Karen's note added after the conversation: this is like the surface of the sphere, in essence its boundary, carrying all the information that is necessary to describe what is contained in the entire volume of the sphere -- in other words, limitations allow the deeper realities to be communicated by compressing the data necessary for both accuracy and expression).

Attentional focus - JV's comment about grasping the cup - attention that accommodates itself to the thing expressed.  We can grasp a cup or grasp an idea. In both cases, we must make space in order to conform to the shape of the thing grasped.

Michael's quote from Frankl on Love:
The Meaning of Love

Love is the only way to grasp another human being in the innermost core of his personality. No one can become fully aware of the essence of another human being unless he loves him. By his love he is enabled to see the essential traits and features of the beloved person; and even more, he sees that which is potential in him, which is not yet actualized but yet ought to be actualized. Furthermore, by his love, the loving person enables the beloved person to actualize these potentialities. By making him aware of what he can be and of what he should become, he makes these potentialities come true...


Identity takes place in the story layer where we interact with others.
In an ideology, an incomplete story, everything is simplified and specified into nothingness.

Seeing is a kind of gathering.
Emil Bock book about Revelation says that time becomes space.

Why is pain necessary? Pain is a way of maximizing the good. The question is "How much good could be experienced without pain?"
Pain makes space for good. What amount of pain is tolerable? Perhaps the question is, How much good do you want to contain?
Saying No to God.

Michael posits that regret is the ultimate punishment. Karen asks where resentment resides in that version of the story?  Also perhaps we will discuss avoidable suffering and unavoidable suffering.
